Package it.polimi.ingsw.view

Class UiHelpers

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.view.UiHelpers
  • public class UiHelpers
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains helper methods needed by both UserInterfaces (cli/gui)

      • directionTranslator

        public static Directions directionTranslator​(java.lang.String s)
        Helper method to translate cardinal directions from IT to EN
        Parameters:
        s - a String which is already in the right form (cardinal point to upper case)
        Returns:
        the enum in Directions linked to the String

      • colorTranslator

        public static PlayerColor colorTranslator​(java.lang.String s)
        Helper method to translate color with enum from italian to english
        Parameters:
        s - color in italian
        Returns:
        PlayerColor enum corrisponding to the italian color

      • genPointFromDirections

        public static java.awt.Point genPointFromDirections​(java.util.List<Directions> directions,
                                                    java.awt.Point start)
        generates the final point from a starting point with the directionList specified
        Parameters:
        directions - list of directions to specify
        start - starting point
        Returns:
        final position after applying in order all direction from start point

      • weaponTranslator

        public static java.lang.String weaponTranslator​(java.lang.String weapon)
        Useful method to translate weapon names from EN to IT (since we use EN weapon names in json)
        Parameters:
        weapon - name of the weapon to be translated
        Returns:
        the weapon name in italian

      • colorAsciiTranslator

        public static AsciiColor colorAsciiTranslator​(PlayerColor playerColor)
        translate player color to ansi color, useful for CLI methods
        Parameters:
        playerColor - color of the player to generate ANSI color
        Returns:
        ANSI color of the specified player color

      • ammoTranslator

        public static java.lang.String ammoTranslator​(java.util.List<Color> ammoList)
        translates the list of color passed as paramter with a nicer version of ammo to display
        Parameters:
        ammoList - list of color to display
        Returns:
        a string representing the ammo view

      • ammoTranslator

        public static java.lang.String ammoTranslator​(Color c)
        translate a single ammo, same as ammoTranslator with color list but just with a single color
        Parameters:
        c - color to translate
        Returns:
        string representing a view of the ammo

      • genColorListFromPowerUps

        public static java.util.List<Color> genColorListFromPowerUps​(java.util.List<CachedPowerUp> powerUps)
        generates a color list from a list of powerups
        Parameters:
        powerUps - list of cached power ups
        Returns:
        a list of color from the colors of the cached powerups passed as parameters

      • genColorFromPowerUp

        public static Color genColorFromPowerUp​(CachedPowerUp p)
        same as genColorLitFromPowerups but with a single CachedPowerUp instead of a list
        Parameters:
        p - cachedPowerup whom color has to be extracted
        Returns:
        color corrispoding to the color of the CachedPowerUp passed as a parameter

      • genTypeListFromPowerUps

        public static java.util.List<PowerUpType> genTypeListFromPowerUps​(java.util.List<CachedPowerUp> powerUps)
        extract the powerups types form a list of cached power ups
        Parameters:
        powerUps - cachedPowerups list
        Returns:
        a list of enum PowerUpType

      • canPay

        public static boolean canPay​(java.util.List<Color> cost,
                             java.util.List<Color> ammo,
                             java.util.List<Color> powerUps)
        Check if the player can pay the specified cost, either with powerups or ammo
        Parameters:
        cost - to be checked
        ammo - current ammo in user's hand
        powerUps - current powerups in user's hand
        Returns:
